Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway! Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: missouriguy_416
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Alpine Lodge! This is a great place for large families not wanting to break the budget. The price is very affordable for similar lodging near Branson. It is conveniently located next to Silver Dollar City so if you are looking for something within walking distance to the shows in Branson you would need to stay somewhere else. The outdoor pool was very nice and clean. We stayed in a 2 bedroom A-Frame cabin. The beds were nice and comfy. The kitchen is very small that is one complaint that I have. It has a mini fridge and an apartment size stove. Very little counter space as well. If you are planning on cooking every day I would recommend spending a little more for one of the newer Chalet's they offer. The owner's were extremely nice and very accommodating. They allowed us an early check-in, gave extra towels and pillows, and even offered an extended check-out. They went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. We would definitely return.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: just outside of St. Louis, MO
Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, on the Lake with a pool”
Reviews.Author: ErinC76
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several resorts on Indian Point over the last 10 years or so. I really enjoyed my time at Alpine. A group of friends gets together every year or so and has an adults only weekend and this place suited us perfectly. We don't like condos and we want to be right on the lake. Many of the other resorts on the lake require a full weeks stay in the summer, this place did not. We stayed in the master lodge which is right next to the pool and the office and a short walk down to the lake and boat dock. We had 8 adults and we were comfortable in the lodge with 2 baths and 2 bedrooms. The A/C was kicking which was good because it was 100+degrees outside! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place for Young familys......”
Reviews.Author: fogsworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Sunday night with a small dog. We got the last lodge! Apart from being over the 100 mark in heat, this supplied a great little A Frame lodge which was lovely and cool and surprisingly spacious. There was bedding for four adults a good sized kitchen and even better still a good sized fridge. All the necessaries, pots pans, plates and various other kitchen utensils were there. It has a swimming pool and boat rental available, and you can also swim from the dock. The dog loved it. All in all a great place to stay which is very affordable

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Jodi K
Reviews.Content: Maybe I've been spoiled in the past by a few other resorts on Table Rock. This resort was acceptable but i just wasn't wowed in any sense. We stayed 3 nights in the newer chalets. The appearance was nice and overall it was a good size for the 6 of us. I wouldn't say the kitchen is 'fully stocked' as advertised. Some of the items were just unusable they were so cheap. Luckily we had brought a huge skillet from home or cooking breakfast just wouldn't have happened with their tiny pan and flimsy cookware. Coffee pot took forever to make coffee and the dishwasher was super super loud. Our bed was terribly uncomfortable. I had to sleep with my son the last night, his was much better. Overall, I think they cut to many corners while constructing and stocking these units and it showed. The owners were very nice & helpful. The pool was nicely kept as were the grounds. Everything is just very tight in the resort. We had issues with 2 cars getting in/out of the parking spots allotted. One of the neighbors had a very large truck making it more difficult. One walk to the dock and you learn quick...the walk back up is extremely steep! The dock itself was nice but we didn't use it as much as we would've liked because of the walk back. Overall...it worked out well and the price was fair but I probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice chalets, great location”
Reviews.Author: NEMO55-55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights with 5 adults and one child. Perfect for our family. We were in #20 chalet which is only 2-3 years old. There are three chalets - I would highly recommend them for a small group. It had two bedrooms with three beds. Two other beds are in the open in the loft area. Two full baths with very cute lodge-like decor. You could sleep 10 people in this chalet, but you might be falling over each other! Full kitchen with dishwasher, plates, glasses, etc. We used pool, walked to lake, went to Silver Dollar City (5 minutes away). Other cabins are available but they are older. Staff is friendly and helpful; family owned for over 30 years. Will come back if get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: zoe1Tx
Reviews.Content: The price was great and it is by the lake but it was a tad too far for us, we had to make two quick turns and we kept missing it in the dark but we actually made a game of it and had fun with it, the rooms were clean but had a bad smell to it, had to go buy a candle

Reviews.Title: “wonderful lake cabins on gorgeous Table Rock lake”
Reviews.Author: jackie s
Reviews.Content: just got back home from 4-day stay. first time visitors and we loved it! the staff was amazingly friendly and accommodating, even tho we arrived at 11PM a day ahead of our actual reservation! it was very clean and modern, even had dishwashers in the cabins. loved it and the spooky creaking dock and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: amitvirat
Reviews.Content: Loved the shape of the homes.. all A shaped..I loved the terrace style rooms on the top.. it makes u feel as if u r just under the roof.. the funny part was the creeking noise.. we friends actually scared each other in the night through that noise.. just by the lake side.. Me and my friends just loved it.. and we have made sure we will be back to the same place soon..

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: sawnjaw
Reviews.Content: The Alpine Lodge was clean, quiet and comfy. Very up to date with the A frame cabin we had and the new 3 bedroom chalets are awesome looking! We had one in the middle of the area so wasn't too far from the pool. Quite a walk down to the lake, when we went to the dock we usually drove, as the hill back up was not much fun to walk after a day on the lake. No complaints though, the dock was quite clean and the swim area was perfect for the kids (and us) to play in the lake with (ladder to get back up was a wonderful thing!). We spent 7 nights there and the cabin did not have a lot of room for 5 during the day (one futon and a kitchen table) but sleeping was perfect. Two beds upstairs in the loft were great for the kids. Only one thing I wish is that it had a full size shower, those small square ones get to be a hassle if you are trying to shave your legs for a week. Also keep in mind that the A frames only have small refrigerators, so pack accordingly. Parking is at a prime and sometimes tough to get through the road, specially with a boat/trailer on the back of your truck, people park along the sides and make it very difficult to travel the road when you have it loaded. Boat ramp was not too bad but coming out we decided to go to the State Marina down the road on Indian Point to put on the truck, worked out great and we will do that on/off from now on and just drive the boat to the resort! No more harrowing skiing boat ramps:) Alpine staff was very quiet and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: STLMOM15
Reviews.Content: Alpine Lodge is a great place to take your family for a true Table Rock Lake/Branson getaway! The A-frame cabins are so cozy and right on the lake with beautiful views! They also offer the new 3 bedroom Chalet's that were just built and gorgeous! This is a family owned property, and they are the nicest people! The price on these cabins can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: gdmuttley
Reviews.Content: Quiet, serene place for an affordable get away - and clean to boot! Location offers adventure or solitude - highly recommend taking advantage of the boat rental - pack your picnic!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing, quiet and great value”
Reviews.Author: Jpe717
Reviews.Content: We were there this past weekend for 3 nights on their special package. We had 3 nights, a full day out on the lake in a pontoon and 2 days at Silver Dollar City (SDC). We cooked in the room, and spent a very nice time relaxing in the beauty of the area. It is extremely close to SDC. As some others have said, it is not luxury, the furniture is not the most comfortable but the location and the beauty is awesome. I was a little disappointed in our view as each cabin is supposed to have a good lake view and ours had mostly trees with a little lake view. We were in #7. I walked around and I would ask for #6 next time for the best view from the basic cabins. The owners were friendly and very flexible with their special packages which was greatly appreciated. Overall this was just so relaxing for us. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: wentzvillemommy
Reviews.Content: Wanted everyone to know that this place is worth your money. We as a large family of 17 went in September and had a great time. It is a beautiful location. We went shopping, boating, fishing and the kids went swimming in the pool. What a nice place. The owners were very helpful finding activities to suit or kids and adults for the whole trip. We very much enjoyed our time there and will return the next time we travel to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price, watch out for the Owners though...........”
Reviews.Author: mippyjean97
Reviews.Content: I would've given a 4 star rating for the time we stayed at the Alpine Lodge, but a few hours after we left I got a call from a very rude man at the Alpine Lodge. He accused my family of breaking a board in one of the futons. I didn't really know what to say. We did have 3 young kids with us, but they were never alone in the living room to jump on the futons, there was a 13 year old and 8 adults in the house also. The young kids were never alone to damage things. The first mornng we were there, my father-in-law was putting the futon bed back into a couch I remember him saying "this thing is broke under here". We were all rushing around trying to get ready and out the door so no one did anything about it. Now looking back we really wish we would have went straight to the office that moment. I honestly didn't think of it again after that. One thing I know for a 100% fact is the futon was only sat on and then slept on by one adult, there is no way that we broke it. Now after I got this call from the rude man I called my father-in-law for more details. He said the board had a big crack in it not broke in half. So maybe it did break while we were there. The owner doesn't seem to understand things break from normal wear and tear. I can understand how there could be a issue of how it happened and so on. I'm a honest person, if we broke there furniture I would have told them right away and took care of it. I think this man KNEW that board was cracked decided not to repair or replace it and instead wait for it to give out, we just happen to be the unlucky ones in the cabin when it happened. The reason I think this rude man is not a honest man, is that on top of him talking to me like I was a criminal trying to get away with breaking something, he said we left the cabin trashed...WHAT????????? I was in shock, I was never informed we were to clean the cabin for the next guest staying in it??? We bagged up all trash, and washed the dishes?? There wasn't stuff laying all over?? It did rain most of our stay there, so maybe the floor got a little more outside stuff on it then normal, also we did have 12 people, that we paid the extra money for???? I mean really...what more did he want us to do?? We are paying to stay there, are we expected to do there job for them and vacume, scrub the toilest, etc..?? Did he want us to do the laundry as well?? I told him we DID NOT leave it trashed, he said "well your idea of clean must be different then ours" in a very condescending tone. I told him "no I guess not,since the house smelled like a stale old house when we opened the door". We had to get candles and fabreeze to make it bearable in there. He informed me he would be charging my credit card for the futon to get repaired. I told him I needed to speak to all the people in the house before I agreed to anything. He just kept saying "oh no" like I was not going to get out of it. I am sorry for this long story, I am pretty annoyed by it, it just happened yesterday and still fresh. At this moment I haven't heard back from the Alpine Lodge. I did call my father after the rude man called me. I asked him to call the Alpine Lodge and talk to them about what he saw with the futon. He did call but spoke with a women, she said the man was down at the cabin dealing with the futon. She didn't know anything about the cabin or futon, so it didn't help much that she was the one to speak with my father-in-law. So that its so far. I would've stayed at the Alpine Lodge again, due to its old charm, affordable prices and pretty setting, but none of that wins over being treated like a liar and told you left the place trashed. I will NEVER stay there again and will NEVER send anyone there. There are lots and lots of places to stay in Branson, pick one of them, beware of The Alpine Lodge

Reviews.Title: “Fancy? No. Great value and fun? Absolutely”
Reviews.Author: BobTerri63389
Reviews.Content: If you are a traveler looking for a 5 Star resort - keep looking because this isn't for you. If you are looking for clean, affordable, comfortable accomodations along with friendly staff and great views of Tablerock Lake - then this is the place for you. On our recent trip to the Branson Area we spent several nights at Alpine Lodge. Everything you need for a quiet, relaxing time is available. We enjoy cooking some of our meals ourselves and the small, clean kitchen provides all you need. If grilling is for you, that's provided as well. We rented a small fishing boat and thoroughly enjoyed our day on the lake. All in all, this is a nice family oriented place nestled along Tablerock Lake. (If Silver Dollar City is an attraction you like, you really can't get much closer than this!)

Reviews.Title: “Apline Lodge Resort -DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: jbadragon
Reviews.Content: We rented the lake house, I paid my deposit for the lake house back in March and we came up to Branson for our July family vacation, first of all .. THIS WAS NOT A LAKE HOUSE.. The website had no pics of the lake house and when I asked her to email some pics she stated"We don't have any pics of the lake house, but it is very nice." That was a total lie, it was disguisting, the supposed lake house was a building on top of their office. The house itself was so nasty, it was very old, the carpet was worn and old, the kitchen had appliances probably from the 70's. The bathroom smelled so awful, like pure URINE. My husband paid over 1,200 for the week for our vacation, after being so disappointed we went down to the office and asked for a refund and she did give us all our money back except for the 100.00 deposit , we left and stayed at the Barrington Hotels and Suites and it was clean and very nice . DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY AT THE PLACE YOU WILL BE SO DISAPPOINTED. I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Impressed”
Reviews.Author: bonbon44
Reviews.Content: We just got home yesterday, Sept 8. While the staff were very nice and helpful, we were not impressed with the cabins at all. They were dark inside, not much lighting, and limited electrical outlets. The elec outlet in the bathroom is totally useless, as there is a mirror below it that blocks it. The TV was above the kitchen table, which made it hard to talk to each other if someone wanted to watch it. The area was secluded, which would be nice, but it was a long drive into town. The website says it's 5 miles, but maybe as the crow flies, but not with those long, winding Branson roads. We got lost the first night and it took us FOREVER to find the place (when we first arrived). The cabins are very old and outdated. The kitchens are not much, no cabinet space and no fridge space. Nowhere to set anything down. It would be almost impossible to cook anything in there. And if you did, you would not have room in the fridge to put leftovers. And don't get me started on the stairs in there. I'm surprised there hasn't been a lawsuit yet. The stairs are very steep and narrow, inside the cabin, and NO HAND RAILS at all. I can't believe no one hasn't fallen and hurt themselves really bad. When you get up to the loft area, where there are two beds, the banister is loose. My sisters said those two beds were VERY UNCOMFORTABLE. It was a hassle, driving in and out of that place. Unless you want to go to Silver Dollar City only, and not the strip, I wouldn't stay there. We won't be staying there again, for sure. For SDC access, it would be great, but we were not interested in SDC. And, I almost forgot the bathroom. YIKES. The shower is so small, you have to be a barbie doll to use it. The people in my family are all big people. If you are over 200 lbs, DO NOT BOOK THIS PLACE!! You will not be able to take a comfortable shower. No place to put your shampoo, and if you put it on the floor and bend down to get it, you will hit your head on the water knobs. It was AWFUL. I wll be so happy to use my own shower today!! There was also no cabinet space in there. A few people could put a few things there, but for the most part, it was just a sink, that's it. No cabinets. And the fact that there was only one bathroom and it was in the bedroom where my husband and I were, people were coming in and out a lot. That wasn't a big deal since they were adults and were quiet, except it just would have been nicer for the people upstairs if they didn't have to treck downstairs to go in the middle of the night. I think I have listed all my complaints... I wanted to do it while it was all fresh on my mind. We just picked the wrong place, that's all.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: RachelBrown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to get away for Labor Day weekend. Man we picked the worst time to go. The Lake was rough we couldn't even leave or boat at the dock people were going by sooo fast the waves coming up to the dock were unbelieveable!! Which led to another problrm on Satuarday morning. Someone decided to blocked in our trailer with our boat with their BIG truck so we couldn't take our boat out until about 8pm when the man came back from spending the day on the lake with HIS BOAT. People down there have no consideration for others. Parking is way too limited to be able to leave your trailer on your vehicle so there are a few places you can leave your trailers; Not to BLOCK people's boats in so that when they are on vacation they can't enjoy their last weekend with NO kids on the lake!!!! The owners of the place acted like it was no big deal saying he was going to tell the man not to do it again. By then the day was about over anyway!! Just some people have no consideration for others and no common sense. Also, the bbq grills that they have were worthless ours had no hadles and the rack was broke. Make sure you come perpared to either eat out or cook on the 1975 stove they offer you in their 3x3 kitchen!!!!!!! Next time we will spend the extra money to stay at Big Cedar. My grandparents stayed there this same weekend and they had NO complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pick for Family Get Away”
Reviews.Author: RoamingLombards
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took her three sons (ages 13, 10 and 5) for an end-of-summer get away to Branson. I thought it was a good deal for a relatively inexpensive vacation with kids. Location - Great if you want quick access to Silver Dollar City (we could hear the train from our balcony) and other signature Branson attractions. Pretty countryside, easy to find. Cabin - Basic and clean. Great view. Kitchenette had a half fridge and limited cabinet/counter space which made cooking a little challenging but basically had everything we needed - even an oven for making frozen pizzas and cookies! Amenities - We did not use the dock or lake access but the pool with a slide and diving board was a hit with the kids. Cable TV in the cabin was nice as well. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside I would say is that parking was limited with some of the cabins. There's no real established parking, you just have to park alongside the road by your cabin. Fortunately there is not much else down that road except a few more cabins.

HotelInfo.Name: Alpine Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 434 Indian Creek Circle, Branson, MO 65616
